WRITING.TITLE: Season 5 jungle starts
WRITING.TEXT: In the first few days of playing the PTS for season 5 me and a friend have been testing out possible different jungle starts. In most of our games the duo, solo and mid will start in their respective lanes whilst the jungler starts at their speed buff. Duo lane: We found that gaining a level in the duo lane can be painful, especially with a low clear support. Because of this we wanted to see if we could take the purple buff and then move into the lane to gain an earlier boost in experience. What we started doing was using belt of frenzy to help clear the purple buff. We then move into lane where we've normally, at most, lost 3 creeps in experience. We clear the remaining lane minions, clear the next wave then move to oracles/red. This so far has relied on at least having one god with high clear attached to abilities. Mid/Jungle: With the speed buff spawning at 25 seconds, before the waves meet in the mid lane, we've had the mid laner throw an ability at the speed buff then run straight to lane. This speeds up the jungle clear significantly, whilst also giving the mid laner a slight boost in experience early as they are unlikely to miss more than 1 creep in the wave. This also lets the jungler get out of their speed buff much faster. Another start we have tested is both the mid and jungle invading the enemy speed buff. For this we have used good early game gods, for example Ne zha + Janus. We make our way over to the opposite side of the map trying to avoid being spotted by the enemy mid or solo. At around 10 seconds after minions spawn, we move forward to the rock just behind the speed buff, from here we can look over it and see who is currently at the buff. If only the jungler is present we wait for them to use an ability then attack them. If the jungle and mid is present we choose a target and attack as soon as the camp spawns, to ensure they can't get the exp for clearing any of the camp minions. In this we buy a sprint on the mid laner and a horrific emblem on the jungler, as a way to ensure we get a kill. So far the invades have gone uncontested and have led to a kill on either the mid laner or the jungler at level 1. From the speed buff we rush to clear the enemy harpies then either go to mid camps or split up, with the jungler going to blue and the mid going to the wave. From what we've seen of this, getting a level 1 kill ensures that both the mid and jungle retain a massive gold lead for the majority of the match. Solo: We haven't found any better start for the solo laner other than to clear the wave or to do their blue buff, given that they can clear it before losing too many creeps or the other solo laner invading. What are people's opinions on the new jungle starts and what have other people seen happen in their games?

Having a completely open ff number will just lead to toxic attitudes and bad reactions between players. If it's a statistic that's only shown to you this might be fine. But I can see players being kicked and bm'd for the friendly fire stat just because its the highest out of the team, regardless of how well they might be playing. It's something that is nice in a good environment but its another possible way towards toxic behaviour from players.

I come from a background of playing MOBAs where toxicity around end game stats is rampant. I've only once come across someone who's caused issues with green circles In Vermintide. However I don't want things added into the game that could lead to more of it.
May as well keep 1 of every weapon and then scrap the ones with worse stats.

Don't need to release Medieval 3 if they just re release Medieval 2

1. Charms initially just give extra stats. When you reach orange tier charms they will give you traits, for instance a chance to not use up a healing item on use, a chance to not use a bomb on throw. 2. Power levels are mainly for the scaling of health in the different difficulties. So a 1 power weapon will do less than a 300 power weapon in legendary. 3. Any box gained will give items towards the character you opened them on. So if you gain a chest as Kerillian (Elf) and open them on Bardin (Dwarf) it will give you items for Bardin. 4. Potions of concentration give you a period of time where your ult/special ability charges up at a much faster rate. 5. There's 3 acts in the standard game. So for act 1 you will have Righteous Stand unlocked, before you can move onto the second map in the act you must complete Righteous Stand. Running through all the maps in recruit custom mode should be easy enough to unlock them all for quickplay. Overall though there is 15 maps in the game. 6. I can't help with Victor, I'm a Kerillian and Bardin main. If its a heavy attack (Held down button and charged) it's most likely armour piercing though. This game is meant to be learned and along with that comes the slow mastery of specific weapons and their playstyles. Learn through play is the best way.

I may be wrong, but I believe the first tier of trinkets won't give extra stats and are sort of placeholder until you get higher tiers. But once you move into green and blue tier they will start to give stats such as extra stamina shields, extra health, curse resistance (reduces amount of health taken by a grimoire)

WRITING.TITLE: Dwarven Runes and the Fortunes of war

Does anyone have information of the locations of these runestones as of yet? #8203;

WRITING.TITLE: Appreciation for the Pub Crawl
WRITING.TEXT: The event map includes entirely new and hilarious voice line interaction between the characters. Has an insanely fun to balance "drunkeness" mechanic. And completely goes against the mood of the rest of the game and general lore for this time period. Absolute insane fun out of nowhere.
I have same issue, all mods turned off so its not a conflict issue. Likely the servers have crashed.
What do you mean by "barbie tanks" ?

There's 5 unique Characters, each with 3 different classes. Each character class has a different archetype. Generally horde damage, tank and special slayer. The overall basis for the classes may be the same, but saying they're generic swinging suggests you haven't been forced to play each class at their limits.

The base class with its "base weapons" falls under the archetypes. With most the characters passive and active abilities you can clearly see that they were designed to fall under certain team roles. For instance Iron Breaker, he has a passive ability that absorbs a hit and then turn that into 10 temp hit points. Whilst his active literally pulls every enemy towards him. He's designed to be an aggro tank. When weapons come into play the devs have within reason left it up to the players. In terms of the dual hammers those pull from the slayer's axes and were added in the DLC as a spice weapon. Do they work on Iron Breaker, for sure, are they the best way to play, possibly but possibly not. Every class has been designed so that it can still function in a solo capacity whilst also filling a specific niche in a team. Weapon differences has opened that up massively. If you pick weapons that are bad at killing armour, they're generally better at something else. #8203; Saying that every class is the same simply because they can all achieve the same thing might be true, but you can tell it doesn't fit with how the characters were designed. #8203; Specifically the question though. Iron Breaker with hammers would fit between tank and horde damage. Mercenary with 2h sword and repeater would be a horde damage with special damage. Zealot in itself is a strange mix class I will accept. Can they all tank, yes. Can they all do damage to everything on the board yes. Doesn't mean they don't fit under design archetypes.

The game runs on weird peer to peer servers that are hosted by the player. What you're experiencing is your connection to the host server being bad, but your client side working fine. It's weird as I'm not 100% convinced the game is run serverside or if only the player's inputs are serverside. #8203; In general this is just lag between the host and you
I've got 160 levels into Kerillian and only gotten one hat from a chest, that hat is rare and on top of that it's good looking. You got a real good drop there.

I've had multiple games with people from other regions within quickplay. I'm South East England based and have played with people from Australia, Singapore, USA, Continental Europe etc. From my knowledge the matchmaking is simply down to player to player connections. In terms of hosting your own games I would assume it would take your host IP location and place that as your region within the lobby browser, however if that's not the case I'm not sure if there is a way to change it.
Pretty sure the icons are on the correct sides, but the colours are the wrong way round on the actual phoenixes.

WRITING.TITLE: You'll never be as good as Cousin Okri!

WRITING.TEXT: The specific part of the model that the daji 3 teleports to is in the same place on the objective models compared to the player models. However as the Objective Models are much larger this teleport point has just been scaled higher, so when Daji teleports she's considered above the ground and so falls. It's not necessarily a bug, but just something that was missed when she was made.

I play from South England and I somewhat enjoy the quickplay roulette. Each time you queue you ask where the host is from. Pretty sure I've had people from each continent matched with me. Granted this isn't a new thing and is more down to time zones and a lower playercount.
